main event: A disc-shaped object was observed by multiple witnesses in Albuquerque, New Mexico on August 9, 1952.
interesting points: The object was round, slightly larger than an automobile, and rose from the ground to an altitude of about 150-200 feet before speeding away to the north at a very high speed.
The object made no sound and disappeared from view in a matter of 3-4 seconds.
One witness, Gordon K. Kendall, was an Air Force intelligence officer who certified the sighting as genuine.
Another witness, J.W., observed the object descend and then ascend vertically, disappearing from view, and was unable to locate it again after trying to photograph it.
The witnesses stated they were familiar with conventional aircraft and confident the object was not any type of known aircraft.
witnesses: Gordon K. Kendall (Air Force intelligence officer), J.W. and his wife
